name: Kowloon Shangri-La Hong Kong

reviews.text: I stayed here during a business trip. Though, my business was mostly in Central, I chose this hotel as it was cheaper in Kowloon then in Central. The location is a good if you like to see the Harbour view. Choose a room with a full harbour view and you will not repent. The hotel is like any other Shangrila Property which is top class and the breakfast was very nice including good vegetarian choices. One strange thing however, was the absence of a bath tub in the room. The room size is big so I dont think the size of the room was an issue. The service is very good. Even if you have work around Central, then it makes sense to live here as going to Central takes around 20 mins in the morning by cab and costs around HKD 150 including the tunnel charge.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and good vegetarian hot breakfast and very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a holiday in Hong Kong. Thank you Shangri-La for making it so memorable and special.
reviews.title: Kowloon Shangri-La didn't let us down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a harbour view room with Horizon Club access, and upon arrival, and without asking, we were upgraded to a harbour view suite, which was most appreciated. The suite was comfortable and clean. The white marble bathroom was luxurious, large and well appointed. We were on the tenth floor and the view was wonderful. We felt very connected with all the activity on the harbour. The two rooms were well appointed and all the staff were helpful and polite. Included was an office/study in our suite. My husband actually used this area as his dressing room and he enjoyed the extra space. A welcoming pot of tea and fresh fruit was a nice touch. We have previously had a suite at Shangri-La, Singapore and the comparison was easily the same experience. The Horizon Club is not quite as big as Singapore, but in a way it is more exclusive and intimate, and the view is fantastic as the Horizon Club is their top floor. Hong Kong harbour turns on a laser show every night at 8pm and is worth enjoying each night of your stay. A highlight of our stay was to see the lights of Hong Kong turn on around the harbour at dusk.
reviews.title: Needs redoing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two excellent cooked breakfasts in the Horizon Club as well, and it was a shame that a business couple were undertaking a noisy meeting on the second day. I couldn't understand why this should happened, as the hotel offers business people specially provided office areas as part of the Horizon Club package. It was crass, thoughtless behaviour, and we were not the only table to notice this lack of courtesy by this noisy couple discussing future employees and their merits/demerits. It was not the hotel staff's fault at all, but I think that business people could be reminded that there is a place for this undertaking.
reviews.title: best hotel experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just loved the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and Avenue of Stars along the harbour foreshore, including a French fashion photography installation. The hotel is directly linked to this area of the waterfront by a walk bridge over the road, and the walk to the Terminal shopping centres near the Star Ferry is not long and is most enjoyable. We did this both days of our stay at Kowloon Shangri-La.
reviews.title: Absolutely superb!
Okish...but think I've been spoilt.....
reviews.text: Stayed in a number of Shangri La's...Singapore, Sydney... And recently stayed in the Waldorf Astoria in Shanghai on the bund (which is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in)...... The Shangri La was ok....but not brilliant.... I read a lot of trip advisor reviews and think people are picky, so now I'm probably going to be picky and a snob... The service was not upto scratch and what I would expect of a Shangri la, it was slow on check in..sat wtg for 10 min in horizon club..... Would have been easier downstairs......first night in horizon club on 20th floor was made to feel like a second rate citizen, apparently I didn't exist so why was in the horizon club? Even though they took 2 passports on check in....they screwed up on the room dates and the card stopped working after 1 night so had lengthy trips up and down 20 floors.... Service was ok but not exceptional.....as we've come to now I Singapore... We booked 2 nights in a horizon club room on points, were literally 10 points short of a 3rd so booked a basic double for the last night rather than paying the rack rate...any other hotel in the world with a jade card would have just extended the room, but no we moved... All on all on reflection I guess it was ok.....but not the exceptional standards we've come to know with Shangri la...... Next time on Hong Kong would defiantly try the HK Island Shangrila over kowloon....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say,but WOW! Very pleased with every aspect of this Hotel. Booked a Harbor view room. The room was spacious, well appointed and immaculately clean. The Bed was luxurious and the sheets were crisp and smelled great. The location was perfect. Their Breakfast Buffet offered anything you could think of and more. The entire staff from Bell hop, to Doorman, to front desk, to waiters were knowledgeable, polite and courteous.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their two star Michelin Chinese Restaurant was superb.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay at the Kowloon Shangri-La Hotel

reviews.text: My Wife and I have been traveling internationally together for the past 20 years. We both agree that this is one of the best Hotels we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Harbour Views and More

reviews.text: My wife & I stayed at the Kowloon Shangri-La for 3 nights in an Horizon Club Room with a harbour view. Not cheap but in consideration of the benefits of the Horizon Club and the view of the harbour it is worth the stretch. Hong Kong Harbour is stunning and worth the extra cost. It can be very misty particularly in bad weather and in the summer months. Don't forget to watch the light & laser show on the Island side at 8pm from the comfort of your room or the Club Lounge. One night was a free night redeemed through the Shangri-La Golden Circle loyalty club but there was a charge HKD600 extra for the harbour view for the night. This made the stay very good value.
reviews.title: Beautiful Shangri-la

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Kowloon Shangri-La for 3 nights. Loved it. The room we booked was a city view but she upgraded us to a deluxe side view harbour which - although it had been a smoking room - they freshened up and was well worth it. The food at the Shangri-La is pretty good as well. We ate in the Lobby a few times and, on our first night, ate at the Chinese restaurant downstairs. The service was really good as were the appointments of the rooms. We also stayed at the Pen, and although that is a more luxurious hotel, the Kowloon shangri-la is not far behind. I think the Shang has better harbour views though as they are completely unobstructed. It also has a great location.
reviews.title: Ahhh Shangri-La!

reviews.text: Every aspect of my stay was excellent at this hotel. Normally I wouldnt choose the Shangrila but opt of another brand, but I can confidently say this establishment is going to the top of my prefered list for Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: We had a suite with large Bedroom, Sitting Room, Spacious Bathroom and closets galore. The view was the only downer ( A great view of the pedestrian walkway with just a harbour glimpse ) but its Hong Kong so you have to expect something like that considering the Hotels location.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Loved it from start to finish
reviews.text: I will warn readers about the prices in some of the restaurants, ( A burger, Ceasar Salad, 2 Bowls of Fries and 4 cokes come to a little over $110 Aussie Dollars ) Which whilst good was expensive.
However the service is excellent and it lives up to the Shangrila Chains well places reputation.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

reviews.text: I can only agree with all the very good reports on this hotel.
reviews.title: VG

reviews.text: I stayed with my family in a superb room which had fantastic views. The attention to detail in this hotel is really good. Every night you came back to the curtains closed, the ice bucket full and a couple of bottles of complimentry water.
reviews.title: lost horizon.... found

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My children loved the way they changed the carpet every day in the lift to match the day of the week.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
This was perfect!
reviews.text: If you want a lovely base for a Hong Kong stay I would recommend it.

we recently stayed for a 4 night stay in 14th floor harbour view deluxe rooms.....welcomed after a 14 hour flight by politeness, efficiency, fresh fruit and pots of chinese tea! Lovely. Staff went out of their way to make everything special and no request was ever done grudgingly........other hotels please note! On my sons 18th birthday got a call from reception enquiring was it Ok for the staff to bring him up a birthday cake............well they did and I am sure other hotels could manage that but the obvious sincerety which went into this gesture was very touching. The fact that 3 gorgeous girls gave him a kiss on his birthday may have helped him forget about being 8,000 miles from home. The lunch and dinner buffets at the hotel are truly superlative in choice abd quality. on our way home we cancelled our 4 night stay in Hotel Intercontinental Hk ( viewed the rooms and they were very small compares with Kowloon Shangri-La) and had another 4 nights in Shangri-La. Best hotel we've ever stayed at and this takes into account NYC, LA, Europe and many others
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel - fantastic views of Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 4 nights. It has an excellent location, close to every place you can visit in HK. It has beautiful views of the port and HK island, you also can see the fireworks at 8 PM from the room. Breakfast is very good and service is beyond our expectations. Don't miss it!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Kowloon Shangri-la in April 2013. The room was great, webhadca Harbour view, the service was fabulous. Tke Kool Cafe had one of the best breakfast ever. This hotel is special.
reviews.title: Loved the Kowloon Shangri-la Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at four Shangri-La hotels in April. They were all five star but those in Hong Kong and Shanghai stood out.
reviews.title: A shining star in a bright firmanent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is close to all things tourist want to do. You can walk to the Star Ferry, along the harbor, or in the main shopping district. Don't miss taking the 'metro' system, superb and easy to use. Stop is right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Brilliant Service!

reviews.text: Rooms are elegant, large, clean, everything is provided including a shoe shine.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Really really annoyed
reviews.text: I don't have any problems with the hotel room per se, but if I can be allowed to pay my bills when I check out that would be perfect (anyways isn't this the usual way how it's done?). I got a call from front desk at midnight (literally around 11.55pm and I was already asleep as I need to get up early for my flight back home) insisting that I need to pay the balance of my bill (1 night in this case, as the other nights were already charged when check-in, and as I was not sure if I need the last night, this night was not charged and a deposit worth more than 1/3 of the night was charged instead). I did not understand while I couldn't pay next morning when checking out, and tried to persuade them that I was already in bed and it might be more convenient to pay just next day. I guess they were determined to claim the money before the mid night - the response was in that case they would come up and get the imprint of the credit card and my signature, the charge just had to be done. I had to get up and get dressed and went downstairs, as I was really widely awake and quite annoyed by it. I have stayed in so many hotels and in so many countries, this is literally the first time I met this. Mine is not a prepaid rate to start with, and call your guest at midnight to interrupt their sleep and insist collecting the charge? Not sure how this can be called hospitality.

Stayed at the Shangri-La hotel in Kowloon, Hong Kong for a few nights this May and I have nothing but positive things to say about this property. The location is great with many restaurants and attractions in walking distance including the promenade. Other attractions such as the Temple Street Night Market (AMAZING place to go in the evening) are a ~$5 USD cab ride away. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful, all with excellent english. The building itself is very modern and well maintained, with an impressive lobby and reception area.
reviews.title: Kowloon Shangri-La Hotel (Tsim Sha Tsui)

reviews.text: Rooms were very modern and spacious, with very nice western amenities. If you want a traditional chinese experience and feel then this hotel is not for you.
reviews.title: First class comfort

reviews.text: Overall I would absolutely stay here again, as the location and hotel are just amazing.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard is very good and the service excellent. Nicely situated with a view to the Hong Kong island skyline and short distance to the major museums and markets. Also close to Harbour City, the biggest shopping mall in that part of the world with all the main shops your looking for.
reviews.title: Location, Service and View

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights en route to mainland China to adopt our baby girl. We had such a great time here, everything was so clean, and the afternoon tea is wonderfful, listening to either a pianist or Harp player.
reviews.title: Excellent all round hotel
Go Now!!
reviews.text: ROOMS : Spacious and warm, hot tea to welcome you, well decorated bathrooms.
LOBBY : Spacious and cool, decorated in marble and a wonderful fountain to cool the air.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, horrible treatment
Best Hotel I have ever stayed in!
reviews.text: FOOD : Awesome, you name it, you can get it, and the sweets, just looking at them you will pile the pounds on !!!!!!!

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: HEALTH CLUB : Swimming Pool is small but cleam. Just right for a dip after a long day in the heat. Well decorated and clean

reviews.title: A Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for several nights at the end of March 2006. The hotel staff is very friendly and the welcome tea set in the room was a nice touch and very comforting after such a long trip. We had a City View room on the 12th floor. The room was very quiet and reasonably updated. Of course, the hotel is on the Kowloon side of the harbor, so it's a bit removed from all of the attractions in Central Hong Kong. Still, the MTR station is not very far away (it's two stops to Central Station) and it's a nice stroll along the water to the Star Ferry terminal which will take you across to Central.

The breakfast buffet is very good as far as hotel buffets go, but it's a bit expensive. If you're looking for something lighter, there's a great Chinese bakery across the street from the hotel that offers delicious baked goods. There's also a very busy Starbucks right down the street for those who need a morning boost. Also, the sushi in the Japanese restaurant in the hotel is excellent.
reviews.title: a good solid 5 star hotel in a good loaction
Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: As far as nearby attractions go, Nathan Road (The Golden Mile) is about a 5-10 minute walk away as is the Hong Kong Museum of Art. Enjoy Hong Kong!

Great Hotel, and a good location. I went round and round trying to find the right place, the island, koowloon, this hotel that hotel etc etc. this was a great hotel in a good location, if you can, try to get an horizon club room, this includes breakfast and two hours of cocktails from 5-7pm. also the horizon club is on the top two floors so if you have a harbour veiw its very nice (we were on honeymoon so the upgraded to a harbour veiw but i had paid for a city veiw....so that was nice. you wont go wrong with this hotel or the location. a good solid 5 star hotel
reviews.title: Almost as good as Island...

reviews.text: We stayed at the Shangri La for 3 weeks, over the Chinese New year. Were picked up in hotel car, greeted at arrival and check in was speedy. Hotel as lovely as the pics on net.
reviews.title: The Shangri-la delivered the goods

description: Located along the legendary Victoria Harbour, the award-winning Kowloon Shangri-La boasts 688 spacious and elegant guestrooms with modern conveniences and luxurious comfort. Five acclaimed food and beverage outlets, including a Michelin-starred Chinese restaurant, together with a sophisticated lounge and a chic bar, offer a range of exquisite cuisines. The Mass Transit Railway is just right next door, and the Airport Express stations and Star Ferry are only minutes away from the hotel, enhancing its already prime location as the hub of business, shopping and entertainment.
